meanings.definition: A lack of wisdom or prudence in policy or management.
meanings.sent1: The impolicy of spending all the budget on unnecessary items led to financial troubles.
meanings.sent2: The government's impolicy in handling the crisis resulted in widespread dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent3: It was an impolicy to ignore the expert advice and proceed with the risky plan.
meanings.sent4: The impolicy of neglecting maintenance turned a small issue into a major problem.
meanings.sent5: The impolicy of procrastination only made the situation worse.

meanings.sent1: The impolicy of cutting corners to save money backfired on the company.
meanings.sent2: Implementing such an impolicy without considering the consequences was a grave mistake.
meanings.sent3: The impolicy of relying on outdated technology slowed down progress significantly.
meanings.sent4: Choosing the impolicy of confrontation over negotiation only escalated the conflict.
meanings.sent5: The impolicy of ignoring customer feedback led to a decline in sales.
